  • Method Details

    • populateProducts

      void populateProducts(String absolutePath)
      This method deletes all products from the table and replaces them with the products from the CSV file located at absolute path.
      Parameters:
      absolutePath - -> Absolute path of file that contains information
      Pre:
      absolutePath != null
      Post:
      isWellFormed() && list.size() > 0

    • removeMenuItem

      void removeMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
      This method removes a single menu item from the list of available ones
      Parameters:
      menuItem - -> menuItem instance to be deleted
      Pre:
      menuItems != null
      Post:
      isWellFormed() && list.size()@pre == list.size()@post - 1

    • addMenuItem

      void addMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
      This method adds a single menu item at index 0.
      Parameters:
      menuItem - -> menuItem instance to be added
      Pre:
      menuItems != null
      Post:
      isWellFormed() && list.size()@pre == list.size()@post + 1

    • editBaseProduct

      void editBaseProduct(BaseProduct updatedProduct, BaseProduct baseProduct)
      This method edits a single base product and updates the corresponding composites
      Parameters:
      baseProduct - -> base product details
      updatedProduct - -> updated product details
      Pre:
      menuItems != null
      Post:
      isWellFormed() && list.size()@pre == list.size()@post

    • addOrder

      void addOrder(Client client, ArrayList<MenuItem> menuItems)
      This method adds an order at the current date and time using the specified orders. The value of the order must be calculated and writes a bill for the specified order.
      Parameters:
      client - -> client that made the order
      menuItems - -> list of menu items to be added to order
      Pre:
      isWellFormed() && client != null && menuItems.size() >= 1
      Post:
      orders.size()@post == orders.size()@pre && map(order).containsAll(menuItems)

    • getAllOrders

      List<Order> getAllOrders()
      Grabs the keySet of the HashMap and returns it as a list of orders
      Returns:
      list of all the orders
      Pre:
      orderDetails != null
      Post:
      nochange

    • clientFilter

      List<MenuItem> clientFilter(String keyword, double minRatingFilter, double maxRatingFilter, int minCaloriesFilter, int maxCaloriesFilter, int minProteinFilter, int maxProteinFilter, int minFatFilter, int maxFatFilter, int minSodiumFilter, int maxSodiumFilter, double minPriceFilter, double maxPriceFilter)
      Filters products based on the criteria that the client requested. If a filter is -1, it is not applied.
      Parameters:
      keyword - -> search substring
      Returns:
      list of updated products
      Pre:
      isWellFormed()
      Post:
      updatedList.size() <= menuItems.size() && forEach menu item contains keyword

    • filterReport1

      List<Order> filterReport1(int minSecondFilter, int maxSecondFilter, int minMinuteFilter, int maxMinuteFilter, int minHourFilter, int maxHourFilter)
      Filters orders between a given start time of day and a given end time of day
      Returns:
      a list of orders conforming to the filters
      Pre:
      isWellFormed()
      Post:
      updatedList.size() <= orders.size() && orders conforms to filters

    • filterReport2

      List<MenuItem> filterReport2(int minFilter)
      Filters to list that contains all the products ordered a minimum number of times so far.
      Parameters:
      minFilter - -> minimum number of times an item has been ordered, by default 0.
      Returns:
      -> list of updated menu items that have been ordered at least minFilter times
      Pre:
      isWellFormed()
      Post:
      updatedList.size() <= menuItems.size() && menu items conforms to filter

    • filterReport3

      HashMap<Client,Integer> filterReport3(int minOrderFilter, double minPriceFilter)
      Filters to a map that contains all the clients that have ordered a minimum number of times so far.
      Parameters:
      minOrderFilter - -> minimum number of orders for each client
      minPriceFilter - -> minimum price for each order
      Returns:
      map of filtered clients and number of orders
      Pre:
      isWellFormed()
      Post:
      map(client) >= minOrderFilter && order list conforms to filters

    • filterReport4

      HashMap<MenuItem,Integer> filterReport4(LocalDate localDate)
      Filters to a map that contains all the products ordered within a specific day and the number of times they have been ordered.
      Parameters:
      localDate - -> date for report
      Returns:
      -> map of menu items and the times they have been ordered on that day
      Pre:
      isWellFormed()
      Post:
      each menu item must be found in at least one order
